page.title: 08FARMS AND CATTLE MARKET
page.content: {DEAN HILL FARM}WAS VISITED BY STACY CORK AND ALAN WHITE. THE FARM IS RUN BY STACY'S GRANDPARENTS. THE FARM IS ABOUT 100 ACRES. THEY USE TWO TRACTORS ONE WITH A LOADER. HE HAS 32 COWS FOR MILKING THEY PRODUCE ABOUT 100 GALLONS OF MILK A DAY. THEY HAVE 6 BEEF CATTLE . EACH YEAR THEY BRING IN 300 BALES OF SILAGE AND 500 BALES OF HAY TO FEED THE ANIMALS.{THE CATTLE MARKET WILLAND VISITED BY ANNABEL MAUDER, VICTORIA POWLES AND EMMA OSMAND. ON WEDNESDAY MORNINGS THE CATTLE MARKET AT WILLAND IS HELD. IT IS STARTED BY A BELL AT 11 am, BY ELSIE. THE FIRST CALF THIS DAY WAS A DEVON/ANGUS BULL ,IT WAS SOLD FOR Â£88. THE SECOND AND LAST CALF WAS A DEVON SHORT_HORN IT WAS SOLD FOR Â£109. MR CARTER HAS BEEN AN AUCTIONEER FOR 45 YEARS AND AT WILLAND FOR 35 YEARS. HE SAID THE AVERAGE AMOUNT FOR A CALF IS Â£100.AVERAGE 12 CALVES AWEEK
